body:
So whenever a staff member is on, or something, every time when somebody is breaking the rules eg. hacksucating, language and all that stuff. It's good to see the staff members doing it, but then there's a ton of players following it up like popular, demoted but re-apllying, and just general players. It's good to see so many Avi's doing that, but the chat is practically spammed. It's good and bad, your views down bellow.
_An Avi.

title: So many followers #

replies.body:
I don't see a problem with it.
Players are just helping out and it only occurs occasionally.
Also, sometimes players do it before the Mods and sometimes Mods aren't even on.

It can also be seen as players helping others.
Maybe those in question don't know what /report is or that what they are doing is against the rules.

IMO it does more good than bad.

If you're really against it, you can turn off chat.
